Package se.opendataexchange.ethernetip4j.segments

Class Summary
CipCommandSpecificDataRequest This class fills info into a byte buffer.
CipMessageRouterRequest Byte Name Type Description 0 Service USINT CipCommandServices 1 Request path size USINT Tag name length (+1 if odd) 2 - x EPATH Byte[] Tag name (special if structure) (x+1) - y Request data Byte[] Depends on service
CipMessageRouterResponse Byte Name Type Description 0 Type USINT Data type 0 Padding byte Byte 0x00 2 Data Byte[] Tag values
CipMultipleMessageRouterRequest Byte Name Type Description 0-5 Header Byte[] {0x0A,0x02,0x20,0x02,0x24,0x01} by default 6-7 Count UINT Number of requests 8-(8+count*2) Request data offsets UINT[] Offset (from end of header) to each request x-y Requests CipPacketRequest[] The requests
CipMultipleMessageRouterResponse Byte Name Type Description 0-1 Count UINT {0x0A,0x02,0x20,0x02,0x24,0x01} by default 6-7 Count UINT Number of requests 8-(8+count*2) Request data offsets UINT[] Offset (from end of header) to each request x-y Requests CipPacketRequest[] The requests
CipPacketRequest A packet segment according to Ethernet IP and CIP specification.
CipPacketResponse Byte Name Type Description 0 Service USINT CipCommandServices 2 General status USINT 0x00 if all ok 2 Message router response CipMessageRouterResponse or CipMultipleMessageRouterResponse 0x20 by default 3 Request path class Byte 0x06 by default 4 Request path logical instance segment Byte 0x24 by default 5 Request path instance Byte 0x01 by default
EthernetIpCommandSpecificData A segment according to the EtherNet/IP Specification.
EthernetIpEncapsulationHeader Represents the encapsulation packet header according to the EtherNet/IP Specification: Byte Name Type Description 0-1 Command UINT Encapsulation command 2-3 Length UINT Length, in bytes, of the data portion of the message, i.e., the number of bytes following the header 4-7 Session handle UDINT Session identification (application dependent) 8-11 Status UDINT Status code 12-19 Sender Context ARRAY of octet Information pertinent only to the sender of an encapsulation command.
EthernetIpItemStruct Represents a "Data and Address item"-segment of a message Type ID UINT Length UINT Length in bytes of the Data field Data
